conclusion: To determine acceleration or deceleration, analyze the graph showing 1/v as a function of x.
The graph plots 1/v on the y-axis and x on the x-axis.
The slope of the graph represents the rate of change of 1/v with respect to x.
v = dx/dt and taking the reciprocal gives 1/v = dt/dx.
The slope of the graph can be rewritten as -1/v^2 * dv/dx.
The slope of the graph is positive.
A positive slope means 1/v is increasing with respect to x.
A negative derivative of velocity with respect to displacement indicates deceleration.
